Neat, yeah this guy's list is closer to something viable. My list is more just humor.

I had considered this, but there is a chance you could whiff. I was really only interested in cards that find you Rhinos with certainty, like Bring to Light and Dark Petition. Unfortunately, there aren't more.
Nice, I missed that one. This can replace the illegal Mercurial Pretender.

I did consider this, but I thought it wouldn't be in the spirit of the deck to include any non-Siege Rhino creatures. Clever Impersonator and Mercurial Pretender (not standard legal) are essentially Siege Rhinos.
Damn, I guess Gatherer is not fully updated - it included M15 cards, my bad. Also, while it would be great to see somebody make this into a legitimate deck, this was just something silly to do.

WRITING.TITLE: 4-Color, 36 Siege Rhinos Deck
WRITING.TEXT:
* 4x [[Siege Rhino]] - This is essential to the deck, the linchpin * 4x [[Dark Petition]] - search for Rhinos * 4x [[Bring to Light]] - search for Rhinos * 4x [[Clever Impersonator]] - copies Rhinos, including ETB effect * 4x [[Mirror Mockery]] - copies Rhinos, including ETB effect * 4x [[Supplant Form]] - copies Rhinos, including ETB effect * 4x [[Mercurial Pretender]] - copies Rhinos, including ETB effect * 4x [[Exert Influence]] - steal other people's Rhinos * 4x [[Mortuary Mire]] - get back dead Rhinos * 1x [[Map the Wastes]] - ramp * 23x Lands - to cast Rhinos or Rhino related spells
* Sideboard = 4x [[Clone Legion]] - if you find that your opponent has no Rhino's in his deck (which is rare), you can swap this in for [[Exert Influence]]
You have to love a set that includes a card with the rules text "and can block an additional ninety-nine creatures each combat."

This is actually my favorite MTG podcast, and this is saying a lot considering how much I enjoy listening to Chapin and Top Level Podcast - not to mention that I have never played a single match of Vintage. It's just great how thoroughly they dissect cards, tactics, the metagame, etc. The level of depth is astounding - the fact they practically devoted an entire episode to the card [[Gitaxian Probe]] speaks to this.

I was saying this in response to someone who truly hated seeing multiple siege rhinos. It was a semi-joking response. A semi because as a sideboard option, it's not crazy. Even in the main deck though - you don't think you'd be able to guess what creatures are important just based on the land they play?
I think [[ember swallower]] is a fine card. It has a good rate and a somewhat scary ability against control. But either there was just no shell for it and/or too many other better cards.
Yeah, the ultimate is just so enticing and seems so obtainable, but sadly is rarely achieved.

WRITING.TITLE: What were some cards from Theros block that you were either surprised or disappointed to never quite make it there in Standard?

WRITING.TEXT: There's always [[infinite obliteration]]
Awesome heavy metal band name.
I practically jumped in my chair when I read the last part.
Spock, for sure. Quark is great as well.
Steals Jace or Nissa pretty easily, if they haven't flipped already by that time of course.
New Gideon's ult is an oddball though.
You guys are barking up the wrong tree.
I wonder if they gave any thought/care about alters. This kind of border is almost like an alter by itself.
Sweet combo with [[Leveler]] !

From what I understand, Languish is a real killer for this deck. But I'm not sure a card exists in standard that allows you to play around it efficiently. Not that it is an answer, but have you considered Obelisk of Urd?
Well, damn.

Waaayyyyy back in the day my brother used an unlimited [[Icy Manipulator]] on me when we had no idea what "Mono Artifact" meant ( http://gatherer.wizards.com/Handlers/Image.ashx?multiverseid=616 type=card ) . He would pay 1 mana multiple times a turn, tapping all of my permanents.
I suppose percentages make more sense. I guess I saw Timmy as being the complete opposite of Spike, but that could be incorrect, and it doesn't necessarily mean Johnny is in the middle.

WRITING.TITLE: On a scale of 1 to 10, 1 being Timmy, 10 being Spike, and Johnny being somewhere in the middle, what would you rate yourself?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm probably about a 6.
This might help: http://www.noahbradley.com/blog/2011/how-to-be-an-artist-without-going-to-art-school/
So I've watched this, too many times. Is that straight, thin, brownish thing pointing down and to the left the STINGER?
Thank you. Usually I sketch to music or movies, but a lot of times I just start making marks on the paper without having any overall idea and it kind of develops on it's own.

The new lands come into play tapped unless you tap one of your non-land permanents. Just throwing an idea out there.
The only people that really "knew" would have pre-ordered a bunch.

The only pack of Legends I was able to get a hold, was $12 at the time. The rare was [[divine intervention]] . In actuality, it probably wasn't the worst I've opened, but the disappointment sticks out in my mind.
You don't really mix the acrylics with oils. You paint acrylics first, then once acrylics are dry you can paint oils on top. Doing this the other way around would cause damage eventually.
I have done both, but I need to make more better stuff and do it again.
Thanks! I do not do alters, sorry :(
